headline: PARAMOUNT COMMENTS ON WARNER BROS. DISCOVERY BOARD'S DETERMINATION THAT PARAMOUNT PROPOSAL COULD REASONABLY BE EXPECTED TO LEAD TO A SUPERIOR PROPOSAL
summary: Paramount Skydance Corporation (NASDAQ: PSKY) ("Paramount") issued the following statement in response to the announcement by Warner Bros. Discovery, Inc. (NASDAQ: WBD) ("WBD") that WBD's Board of Directors has determined that Paramount's revised $31 per share, all-cash offer to acquire WBD could reasonably be expected to lead to a "Company Superior Proposal" under the terms of WBD's merger agreement with Netflix, Inc. (NASDAQ: NFLX):

(NASDAQ: NFLX):

headline: Paramount Raises Offer for Warner Bros. What Happens Now.
summary: Paramount has made a revised offer for Warner Bros. Discovery. For now, Warner is still backing its deal with Netflix.

content.title: Paramount Raises Offer for Warner Bros. What Happens Now.
content.summary: Paramount has made a revised offer for Warner Bros. Discovery. For now, Warner is still backing its deal with Netflix.

headline: Warner Bros reopens door to Paramount, putting Netflix deal in doubt
summary:
STORY: Warner Bros Discovery on Tuesday reopened the door to a takeover by Paramount Skydance.

That is after Paramount raised its offer for the studio to $31 per share.

The intense bidding war for the firm behind Batman and Harry Potter has reached fever pitch, with the board signaling that Netflix may lose its place as the preferred suitor.

In its revised bid, Paramount also raised the termination fee it would pay should the deal fail to gain regulatory approval to $7 billion — up from $5.8 billion. 

It also agreed to pay Warner shareholders 25 cents per share per quarter, for every quarter beyond September 30 that the deal does not close.

The rival bidder also agreed to contribute more equity, should banks raise concerns about Paramount's ability to finance the deal when it closes.

Warner's board said it has not determined whether the revised proposal is superior to a merger with Netflix, but said directors would give it further consideration. 

Should a superior deal emerge, Netflix has four business days to revise its offer.

The streaming giant has offered $27.75 per share in cash for the movie and television studios, its catalog and HBO Max streaming service. 

None of the firms involved commented on reports of the new offer.

content.title: Warner Bros reopens door to Paramount, putting Netflix deal in doubt

headline: Netflix Faces Paramount Challenge In High Stakes Warner Bros. Battle
summary: Warner Bros. Discovery has received a revised takeover offer from Paramount Skydance that could be considered superior to Netflix’s existing agreement. The new proposal has reignited a bidding contest and puts NasdaqGS:NFLX’s planned acquisition of Warner Bros. at risk. Netflix now has a limited window to match or counter Paramount’s bid while facing regulatory scrutiny and political opposition tied to a Justice Department antitrust investigation.
